result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert L. Woods was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to each other.

superMiscConds.notes: Good faith effort to obtain/maintain full-time employment.

Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO.
Defendant is not eligible for CIP or SAP on any of the counts on which he has been sentenced. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

Clerk Cheree
Cases 13CF629, 14CF405 and 14CF644 called: 2:50pm
State appears by ADA M.Puerner.  Def appears in person/in custody and with Atty John Wallace.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW - victim impact statement filed.

NGI pleas on all counts are withdrawn by Attorney Wallace
COURT questions defendant re: withdrawing NGI plea - COURT finds withdrawal freely and voluntarily made and allows withdrawal of NGI pleas in all counts.

State moves to:
14CF405>>D&RI entire file
13CF629 - Ct. 4 (Substantial Battery/Intend Bodily Harm/Repeater)>>D&RI
14CF644 - Ct. 2 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI

PLEA:
13CF629 - Ct. 1 (Attempted Robbery with Use of Force/Repeater)>>GUILTY
13CF629 - Ct. 2 (Strangulation and Suffocation/Repeater)>>GUILTY
13CF629 - Ct. 3 (Threats to Injure/Accuse/Repeater)>>GUILTY
14CF644 - Ct. 1 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>GUILTY

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty

COURT ORDERS: 
13CF629 - Ct. 1>>3 years TOTAL; 1 year incarceration and 2 years ES
13CF629 - Ct. 2>>8 years TOTAL: 5 years incarceration and 3 years ES
13CF629 - Ct. 3>>6 years TOTAL: 3 years incarceration and 3 years ES
14CF644 - Ct. 1>>3 years TOTAL: 1 year incarceration and 2 years ES

CONDITIONS OF ES: N/C with victim A.W.; Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; CC; Restitution of $1157.54 to be paid from $25,000 cash bond and paid to victim; GFE to obtain/maintain FTE.
 
>>All sentences to run CONSECUTIVE to each other
>>Credit in 13CF629 Ct. 1 ONLY>>196 days credit for time already served
>>Defendant is not eligible for CIP or SAP on any of the counts on which he has been sentenced

State notes Defendants motion to change plea to NGI was previously entered at hearing 2/9/15 -- COURT notes examiner was appointed only on the 13CF629 file as that was completed previously, and COURT will not appoint another examiner in that case, now that NGI pleas have been entered in 14CF cases.
COURT notes intent to proceed to trial on 13CF629; Attorney Wallace requests COURT hold off on appointing examiner for the 14CF cases, as parties may have agreement.
Matter set for 2/18 at 2:30 for 30 minutes, and if agreement is not reached, then parties will use that time for MIL that were previously filed by both parties.
